title: Dataset - Token / CNFT Analytics
description: Currently NFT data is disparate and lacking metadata standards, making it hard to query and gain insights from.

f6_assessments.q0: As a data nerd, I love these types of projects. This is a great small project to gather NFT data in one place. Easy access to these types of data are what enable other developers to play around in developing new projects.
f6_assessments.q1: Well laid out plan from a team with great experience. No reason to doubt they will succeed.
f6_assessments.q2: The detailed plan with timelines make auditing of delivery easy. Whilst I personally would love to have this type of resource available, it might be nice to add some KPI's and goals on how much they think it will be used.

f6_assessments.q0: NFTs are a major component in the transaction being carried out in the Cardano chain. The NFT projects claim successes to attract interest in them. In order to get a realistic picture of the quantum of activity taking place in the NFT market space a data analytic tool that reads details straight from the chain is required. The project will build queries based on available input identified during the data discovery phase. This project has the potential to improve the transparence in the NFT market space of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers are operating a pool and also a https://canuckz-nft.io NFT project. This NFT site has a professional look and is functional. People who could build and operate this site are very likely to be capable of completing this proposal in time.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal will produce a Github repo with SQL queries and data definitions for use by developers and people who will be able to access DB-synch and other developer tools. The output is not accessible on the open website and its use will depend on the number of projects which will adopt the code to build the analysis sites.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal aims to make the NFT data (or metadata) more easily available. Unfortunately, the proposers did not put this solution in the context of other projects, so the added value of this dataset to the ecosystem is difficult to assess. It is clear that any simplification on the blockchain will help the development of applications (the goal of this challenge), but the additional benefit should be clearly explained for getting a higher rating.
f6_assessments.q1: The team presents a detailed technical plan for implementing this idea. The end result is clearly described. This is also continued in the listing of the budget. This is also clearly structured and comprehensible. The requested amount is definitely fair and reasonable. The team behind the idea consists of two experienced developers. However, the proof-of-live is missing. No links or references are provided. A link to Github or LInkedin would increase the trust in the team. Without this info, I can't state (despite the good plan) that this project will be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: As mentioned before, the team does not provide any information about a possible source that documents the progress of the proposal for the community. With this addition, the proposal could receive a very good rating. Because after all, the time frame and the roadmap are clear and understandable. In addition the team could add a specific number (metric) to further measure the success (e.g. number of users).

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal provides a very necessary component for users of the CNFT ecosystem, as developers have to manually run cardano-node, along side DB-Sync and even Cardano GraphQL in order to query for the 721 NFT data that they need. 

This proposal successfully addresses the need of a high-level API to interact specifically with NFTs on the Cardano Blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team presented a detailed overview of their roadmap and goals, some more specific timeline for the milestones would be nice, however the budget is within reason and the team seems capable of implementing this proposal successfully.

The team appears to be more than capable of implementing what they have described in the proposal, given their professional experience completing such projects.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is lacking in clearly defined timeline for the KPIs presented and more information would be a bonus, but the budget is realistic and the proposal is very well laid out for catalyst to quantitatively measure how successful the project was.

solution: Open-source code repository for generating an analytics dataset from a mixture of on chain db-sync data as well as external data sources
experience: Founders of Cardano Canucks and Canuckz NFT with 30+ yrs experience in data infrastructure, analysis and visualization for enterprises.
